intro: Pentopetia gracilis, commonly known as the slender pentopetia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a velvety texture. Pentopetia gracilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
